title: multiple create server response only has a single server's info

comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~yugsuo

comments.content:
Triage result
=============
If I understand it correctly, the boolean parameter "return_reservation_id" can be used for that. If this parameter is set to "True" in the REST API call to create multiple servers [1], The response will contain one reservation ID which can be used to query for all servers which match this [2]. 

Maybe this solves your current problem, but I agree that I would expect a list of servers too. I can only assume that this solution got chosen because it could take a while to launch all, lets say 40 servers, and the REST API would have to wait until this is done to send a response which contains the server details of all 40 servers.

Open Questions
==============
Does anyone from the API subteam have a more profound answer?

References
==========
[1] https://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/nova/tree/nova/api/openstack/compute/multiple_create.py?id=f1524dfbcd32b61116d4eb80b269272e60811cef#n26
[2] https://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/nova/tree/nova/api/openstack/compute/servers.py?id=f1524dfbcd32b61116d4eb80b269272e60811cef#n1107

comments.content: I think every item in the list doesn't need to contain too much details, only some significant information are enough, such as id.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~yugsuo

comments.content:
This is potentially an API enhancement, which would need a nova-spec. However, multiple create is an API that's somewhat out of favor at this point.

I'd personally be opposed to extending multiple create like this. If the application needs / wants more granular info just issue the creates yourself don't push through the multiple create interface which is going to have less info.
